 This is a tough question that I have often struggled with. It is murder and not killing. God himself instituted the death penalty for certain offenses. God Himself commanded wars. Personally, I believe that Jesus taught us to love our enemies. Not an easy task but possible for one in touch with Him. I know a man in his 80s who was a medic and concientious objector during wwII. He never carried a gun and was not captured. But he saw a lot of action. He is without a doubt one of the kindest most gentle men I know. He did his part in the war and cared for people. He would have killed if he had been trapped with no other way out. (or so he tells me). 
 
 I believe God does not want us (those in the US in particular) to sit by and watch others in the world destroy and harm other people. I don't necessarily believe our government tells us everything but, I still believe some wars have been necessary. The war in Iraq I think was more a war about the people of Iraq than about WMD (this is what is was for me anyways). Go to the US whitehouse website. They have anecdotal information reported about how people were treated by that government. it is really overwhelming. 
 
 I suppose my answer is more of a musing than an answer but in a nutshell, my opinion is we are eternal beings and that to see our lives on earth as all there is, is a very short sited perspective.
